etymology.description: Two 人: one upright (亻) and one upside down (𠤎) indicating reversal/change; Shuowen also considers 𠤎 phonetic.
etymology.interpretation: An upright person paired with an inverted person depicts reversal, conveying the idea of transformation or change. Some analyses treat 𠤎 as contributing sound, but the primary sense comes from the visual contrast.

examples.chinese: 我们的计划需要变化(我們的計劃需要變化)。
城市正在快速现代化(城市正在快速現代化)。
把废物转化为能源(把廢物轉化為能源)。
